file_content.text: That HK unit you destroyed... he waited loyally for three hundred years. I can rebuild him, but it won't be the same.
Can't you see you're on the wrong side? The Emperor is death--for you, for me, for the galaxy.
The Emperor is forever, and he has given us the power to rule.
The Emperor is supreme.
All you'll rule is a graveyard.
Death is nothing. Death is power. The Jedi don't understand that.
The Sith can master death.
I understand well enough.
No nation has ever been as strong or as brilliant as the Empire is today. If we terrify you, the fault is yours.
I'm proud to serve the Empire.
You really believe that. Then I was right.
I'm not on anyone's side. I take a job and I see it through.
I don't do politics.
And turn a blind eye to the consequences. I understand.
Listen to yourself. If you use the Foundry to exterminate billions, how are you any better?
You need help. You're corrupt.
I'm doing this to save lives, not for glory. I will mourn for the dead and do what I must.
Idiot. I've already won.
I've done what no one else could do.
As a young Jedi, I went to war. I accepted violence and darkness, and the Emperor called to me from across the galaxy.
He made me a Sith Lord and named me Darth Revan. I killed for him--I turned on the Republic--but I've found redemption.
On Dromund Kaas, there was a cult founded in your honor.
Revan. I know that name...
So I've heard. Not what I would've wanted, given the things I did.
"Darth Revan." I don't know the name.
I've never heard of you.
Three hundred years ago, the Republic didn't know the Empire existed. How did you get the attention of the Emperor?
How did you become Sith?
I discovered hints of your Empire on dead, lost worlds--Korriban and Malachor. The Emperor felt it, and he summoned me.
I nearly destroyed the Republic, and that nearly destroyed me. When the Jedi returned me to the light, my memory was shattered.
It look me years to track and confront the Emperor again. I tried to end him, and he murdered my companions and locked me away.
For three centuries, you've been steeping in hate. Now that you're free...
So this is your revenge.
What am I supposed to learn from all this?
Why tell me your story?
I want you to know we're enemies for a reason.
Trying to justify destroying a whole culture to yourself? Or just hoping to bore me to death?
You like to ramble, I see.
That's enough!
All those years in his prison, I could feel him in my mind. Drawing on my connection to the Force... but I was in his mind, too. Fighting him.
Only I've been both Jedi and Sith, and found clarity in the Force. Only I understand him, and his death is my responsibility.
You think you're the only Jedi who's ever fallen? You're one of thousands, "Revan"... and you're more deluded than most.
You're just another madman.
Think what you want. It doesn't matter.
This isn't clarity, and this isn't your responsibility. There's another path.
You can still be saved.
There was a time... a moment when my destiny wasn't certain. That moment is gone.
That's enough. [Attack]
I've saved the Republic twice before--I've fought Mandalores and armies of the dark side. You won't stop me.
Let's finish this. [Attack]
Then we fight.
We have nothing to discuss.
"And in the end, as the darkness takes me, I am nothing." Now I know how you felt, my friend.
The Empire will become dust! I will make it so.
I will show you the power of the Force in balance.
You've never fought anyone like me. I was Sith. I am Jedi!
Turn and run!
